head.title: Currency Exchange Rates

meta.name: description
meta.content: This page displays a table with actual values, consensus figures, forecasts, statistics and historical data charts for - Currency Exchange Rates. Foreign exchange is the largest financial market in the world as volume averages $5 trillion per day, according to the Bank for International Settlements. This page provides a table with exchange rates for several currencies including the latest interbank exchange rate, yesterday close (12AM UTC) plus weekly, monthly and yearly percentage changes.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Country List,Currency,data,chart,actual,historical,values,calendar,forecast,graph,

body.script: IsDarkMode=false;

input.style: font-size: 1.1em; border: 0px; color: #333; border-bottom: 1px solid #858585; background-color: transparent;

ul.style: position: fixed; width: 100%; top: 42px; border-top-color: #FFF; display: block; padding: 0; border: 0;

br.span: Download historical data for 20 million indicators using your browser.
Direct access to our data from your apps using any programing language.

a.br: Manage your notifications for calendar releases and financial markets.

div.h2: This page displays a table with actual values, consensus figures, forecasts, statistics and historical data charts for - Currency Exchange Rates. Foreign exchange is the largest financial market in the world as volume averages $5 trillion per day, according to the Bank for International Settlements. This page provides a table with exchange rates for several currencies including the latest interbank exchange rate, yesterday close (12AM UTC) plus weekly, monthly and yearly percentage changes.

li.div: Global data and statistics, research and publications, and topics in poverty and development

div.a: World Bank Support for Country Access to COVID-19 Vaccines

div.p: With 189 member countries, staff from more than 170 countries, and offices in over 130 locations, the World Bank Group is a unique global partnership: five institutions working for sustainable solutions that reduce poverty and build shared prosperity in developing countries.

The World Bank Group works in every major area of development. We provide a wide array of financial products and technical assistance, and we help countries share and apply innovative knowledge and solutions to the challenges they face.

li.a: Environmental and Social Policies for Projects
World Bank Support for Country Access to COVID-19 Vaccines

div.p: We face big challenges to help the world’s poorest people and ensure that everyone sees benefits from economic growth. Data and research help us understand these challenges and set priorities, share knowledge of what works, and measure progress.

li.a: World Bank Support for Country Access to COVID-19 Vaccines

input.name: wcmmode

div.class: lp-img-overlay lp__color lp__left_align col-lg-10 col-md-10 col-sm-12 col-xs-12

h1.a: Stagflation Risk Rises Amid Sharp Slowdown in Growth

div.p: Global growth is expected to slump from 5.7 percent in 2021 to 2.9 percent in 2022— significantly lower than 4.1 percent that was anticipated in January, according to the World Bank’s latest Global Economic Prospects report.
div.a: New Op-Ed from World Bank Group President David Malpass

img.alt: Farmer holding maize in a field with a backdrop saying
img.title: Farmer holding maize in a field with a backdrop saying

h2.a: Why Is the World Facing a Food Crisis?

div.p: The world is facing rising food prices that are hitting poor and developing countries hardest. Even before COVID-19 reduced incomes and disrupted supply chains, chronic and acute hunger were on the rise due to factors, including conflict, socio-economic conditions, natural hazards, climate change and pests. In this episode of The Development Podcast we explore the challenges potential solutions to the food price crisis and hear from a restaurant owner in Cairo who is struggling with the rising cost of bread.

div.a: Why Is the World Facing a Food Crisis?

img.alt: The World Bank Group’s Support to Transitioning Countries from Coal
img.title: The World Bank Group’s Support to Transitioning Countries from Coal

div.p: Our newest immersive story follows Armenia's journey towards accession to the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI), which has helped increase transparency and enhance accountability in the country's mining sector - setting the stage for the people of Armenia to benefit fully and equitably from the country’s resources

li.a: The World Bank and Extractive Industries

div.p: The invasion in Ukraine will have far-reaching economic and social impacts - well beyond the immediate impact it is already having on the lives and livelihoods of those in the country. The World Bank Group continues to coordinate with Ukraine and other development partners to assess these costs and develop a robust response to help the Ukrainian people during this difficult period. Learn more.

li.a: Joint Statement of Heads Of International Financial Institutions With Programs in Ukraine and Neighboring Countries

div.h2: Newsletter
Our Mission

div.h3: The World Bank Group has two goals,
div.p: to end extreme poverty and promote shared prosperity in a sustainable way

div.h2: Data
div.h3: We engage the development community with real-world statistics

div.span: Open Data On selection, change the data

div.class: col-lg-7 col-md-7 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 lazy chartIndex0 chartShow
col-lg-5 col-md-5 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 chartCard0 chartCardShow

div.p: Agriculture is crucial to economic growth: in 2018, it accounted for 4% of global gross domestic product (GDP) and in some least developing countries, it can account for more than 25% of GDP.

But agriculture-driven growth, poverty reduction, and food security are at risk: Multiple shocks – from COVID-19 related disruptions to extreme weather, pests and conflicts – are impacting food systems, resulting in higher food prices and growing hunger. Read more

div.class: col-lg-7 col-md-7 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 chartIndex1 chartShow
col-lg-5 col-md-5 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 chartCard1 chartCardShow

div.p: Many countries are facing growing levels of food insecurity, reversing years of development gains, and threatening the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals by 2030. Even before COVID-19 reduced incomes and disrupted supply chains, chronic and acute hunger were on the rise due to various factors, including conflict, socio-economic conditions, natural hazards, climate change and pests. The impact of the war in Ukraine adds risk to global food security, with food prices likely to remain high for the foreseeable future and expected to push millions of additional people into acute food insecurity. Read more

div.class: col-lg-7 col-md-7 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 chartIndex2 chartShow
col-lg-5 col-md-5 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 chartCard2 chartCardShow

div.p: While the outlook for global food supplies remains favorable, food prices increased sharply due to elevated input prices which, combined with high transport costs and trade disruptions due to the war in Ukraine, are raising import bills. That hits poor and developing countries hardest, as they depend on food imports the most. Read more

div.h2: Results
div.h3: We support countries' poverty reduction strategies

div.p: Access the World Bank's portfolio of more than 12,000 development projects, including current and historical data since 1947.

head.title: Crypto Currencies - Live Exchange Rate Price Quote Data

meta.name: description
meta.content: Trading Economics provides data for several crypto currencies including live bid/ask quotes, last trading prices, exchange rates, forecasts, charts with historical time series and news. This table was last updated on Wednesday, June 15, 2022.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Crypto Currencies - Live Exchange Rate Price Quote Data, data, price, quote, chart, historical, forecast, table, news

head.script: var TESymbol = ''; var TECountry = ''; var TECategory = ''; var TEFrequency = ''; var TELanguage = ''; var TELastUpdate = ''; var TEChartVersion = ''; var symbol = ''; var symbolType = ''; var hasCalendar = false; var isLoggedIn = false; var TEAlertsName = ''; var TEChartsDatasource = ''; var IsMobile = false; var TEChartsMeta = ''; var TEForecast = []; var TEAuthorization = ''; var TESecurify = ''; var TESecurifyUrl = ''; var TEType = ''; var TEChartUrl = '/forecast/crypto'; var TEComparable = 0; var isAlertsLoaded = false; var IsDarkMode = false;

body.script: IsDarkMode=false;

input.style: font-size: 1.1em; border: 0px; color: #333; border-bottom: 1px solid #858585; background-color: transparent;

ul.style: position: fixed; width: 100%; top: 42px; border-top-color: #FFF; display: block; padding: 0; border: 0;

br.span: Download historical data for 20 million indicators using your browser.
Direct access to our data from your apps using any programing language.

a.br: Manage your notifications for calendar releases and financial markets.

div.h2: Trading Economics provides data for several crypto currencies including live bid/ask quotes, last trading prices, exchange rates, forecasts, charts with historical time series and news. This table was last updated on Wednesday, June 15, 2022.

div.span:
Copyright ©2022 TRADING ECONOMICS
All Rights Reserved
